page.title: 16VICTORIA COLLEGE, ST.HELIER
page.content: Victoria College was established in 1852 and stands on a hill overlooking St.Helier. It is a fee paying public school aided by the States of Jersey. The 600 boys follow an academic course and are proud of their sporting record especially against their great rivals, Elizabeth College, Guernsey. The school motto is{Amat Victoria {Curam}which means "A Victorian thrives on work". The school has a boarding house for overseas students and a preparatory school, both on the same campus. The Prep also excels in sport and is famed for its choir and annual play. Many Old Victorians play a prominent role in island life (eg.the Bailiff designate Mr.P.Crill) and among famous OV's are Kenneth More and Colonel Blashford-Snell.
